intro: Alyxia revoluta, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows along coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in the early morning and close by midday. Alyxia revoluta is also known for its ability to thrive in salt spray environments, making it a hardy and resilient species.
